description.en: ![](https://github.com/sanskrit-coders/jyotisha/blob/master/jyotisha/panchangam/temporal/festival/images/kanchi-jagadgurus/jagadguru-01.jpg)Born of a brahmin called Nāgeśa in the village called Maṅgala of the Chola country, the erudite saint well-known as Śrī Jñānottama, foremost among logicians, having adorned the Pīṭha of preceptors for sixty-three years, attained salvation/siddhi on the seventh day of the bright fortnight in the month of Mārgaśīrṣa of the year Ma 5atha.

shlokas:
jAtO maGgalanAmni cOlaviSayE nAgEzasaMjJAd dvijAcchrIjJAnOttama ityavAptabirudO yastArkikAgrEsaraH.
jJAnAnandamunistriSaSTizaradaH sammaNDya pIThIM gurOH siddhiM manmathamArgazIrSasitasaptamyAm avApatsudhIH..13..
